text: Does anyone know if anyone has looked at making (Zygote-)differentiable Julia code callable from within JAX?

elements.text: Does anyone know if anyone has looked at making (Zygote-)differentiable Julia code callable from within JAX?

text: I feel like if anyone has <@U90JR0C80> would know.

text: I only know how to call Jax from Julia. Not the other way :p

elements.text: I only know how to call Jax from Julia. Not the other way :p

text:
It's relatively easy to do following this tutorial <https://jax.readthedocs.io/en/latest/notebooks/How_JAX_primitives_work.html#Defining-new-JAX-primitives>
~However it's rather difficult to make `jax.jit` to work. For that case Julia has to be called through C API, not PyJulia, and relevant bindings to XLA::custom_call need to be written <https://www.tensorflow.org/xla/custom_call>~
I just found that there is a `jax.experimental.host_callback`that could help make custom primitives calling Julia through PyJulia to work with `jax.jit` .
<https://jax.readthedocs.io/en/latest/jax.experimental.host_callback.html>

text: Amazing — it would be great if someone could write a Python lib that wraps using this to call into Julia nicely. Could be a good student project or something.
